question: What documents are required to open a savings account?
Which proofs of identity and address should I provide for a savings account?
What paperwork do I need to submit when opening a savings account?
Can you list the required documents for a savings account application?
How do I apply for a savings account and what documents are needed?
What should I prepare before opening a savings account?
Which ID proofs are accepted for opening a savings account?
What are the formalities for opening a savings account?
What supporting documents are needed to open a savings account?
What proofs do I need to show for identity and address while applying for a savings account?

What should I attach along with the application form for a savings account?
Are passport-size photographs mandatory for opening a savings account?
What verification documents are required for a savings account?
How can I make sure my savings account application is complete?
What documents are accepted as proof of address for a savings account?
Which papers are generally asked for when opening a savings account?
What are the document requirements for getting a savings account approved?
What proofs and paperwork are mandatory to open a savings account?
How to fill and submit the savings account form with all necessary documents?
answer: Documents Required for a PDCC Bank Savings Account: Application form (downloadable from the website), Identity Proof (PAN Card, Voter ID Card, Passport, Driving License), Address Proof (Latest Telephone Bill, Latest Electricity Bill), and Two latest passport size photographs. Key Features include a variety of accounts tailored to your savings needs, easy monitoring via Passbook, RuPay Debit card with Annual Fee, 4 free withdrawal transactions (including Branch Cash and PDCC/Other ATM withdrawals), a daily withdrawal limit of Rs. 10,000/-, and all transactions chargeable as per published rates. Disclaimer: Any government charges, duties, or taxes imposed on the Bank will be debited from the customer's account. Call to Action: Download the application form from our website and visit the nearest PDCC Bank branch to open your savings account.

question: What documents are required to open a current account for business purposes?
Which proofs of identity and address should I provide for a current account?
What paperwork do I need to submit when applying for a current account?
Can you list the document requirements for opening a business current account?
How do I apply for a current account and what documents are needed?
What should I prepare before opening a business current account?
Which ID proofs are accepted for opening a current account?
What are the formalities for opening a current account for business use?

What proofs do I need to show for identity and address while applying for a current account?
How can I complete the documentation process for a business current account?
What should I attach along with the application form for a current account?
Are photographs mandatory when opening a current account?
What verification documents are needed for a current account?
How can I make sure my current account application is complete?
What documents are accepted as proof of address for a current account?
Which papers are generally asked for when opening a current account for a business?
What are the document requirements for getting a current account approved?
What proofs and paperwork are mandatory to open a current account?
How to fill and submit the current account application form with the required documents?
answer: Documents Required for a PDCC Bank Current Account: Application form (downloadable from the website), Identity Proof (PAN Card, Voter ID Card, Passport, Driving License), 3 recent color photographs, and PAN Card or Form 60/61 if applied for PAN. Key Points include that current bank accounts are operated to run a business, require a higher minimum balance compared to savings accounts, and incur a penalty if the minimum balance is not maintained. The main objective is to enable businessmen to conduct business transactions smoothly, with interest charged on short-term funds borrowed from the bank and no restriction on the number or amount of deposits. Disclaimers: Any other identity, address, or entity document can be accepted subject to the bank's satisfaction. KYC documents should be valid on the date of submission. The above are indicative KYC documents and are subject to change as per regulatory guidelines and internal KYC Circulars of PDCC Bank. Call to Action: For more information, please visit the nearest PDCC Bank branch.

question: What is the Anywhere Branch Banking facility and how does it work?
Can I withdraw cash from any branch using the Anywhere Branch Banking service?
What types of accounts are eligible for cash withdrawal from any branch?
How can I transfer funds from one branch to another?
What is the process for funds transfer under Anywhere Branch Banking?
Can I deposit a cheque at any branch, or only at my home branch?
How can I check my account balance at a branch other than my home branch?
Is it possible to get my account statement printed from any branch?
Can I print my passbook at any branch location?
What services are included under the Anywhere Branch Banking facility?
What is RTGS and how does it help in fund transfers?
What is the difference between RTGS and NEFT transfers?
During what hours can NEFT transactions be processed?
How does NEFT operate and when are the transactions settled?
What are the benefits of using RTGS for fund transfers?
Can I transfer funds instantly using RTGS?
What kind of fund transfer services are available through branches?
How can I use the funds transfer in and transfer out options?
Can I request a statement or balance enquiry at any branch under ABB?
Are all banking services like cheque deposit and passbook printing available in every branch?
answer: Anywhere Branch Banking (ABB) Services allow you to access your account and perform transactions from any PDCC Bank branch across the country. Eligible Accounts include Savings Account, Current Account, Cash Credit Account, and Overdraft Account. Available Services include cash withdrawal from any branch in case of urgent need, funds transfer to another account, cheque collection in your favour, remote transfers between branches, balance enquiry, account statement requests, and passbook printing at any branch location. Fund Transfer Methods include NEFT (Deferred Net Settlement basis, with transactions settled in hourly batches from 9 AM to 7 PM on weekdays and 9 AM to 1 PM on Saturdays) and RTGS (Real Time Gross Settlement for continuous, individual transaction settlements). Call to Action: Visit any PDCC Bank branch to experience the convenience of Anywhere Branch Banking.

question: What is IMPS and how does it work?

How do I access IMPS on my mobile phone?
Is IMPS faster than NEFT or RTGS?

Can I send money through IMPS without adding a beneficiary?
What are the limits for sending money through IMPS?
How do I register for IMPS on my mobile banking app?
Can IMPS be used to transfer funds at night or on public holidays?
How secure is IMPS for online fund transfers?
What should I do if my IMPS transaction fails?
Can IMPS be used to send and receive money instantly between different banks?
answer: IMPS (Immediate Payment Service) is an interbank electronic instant mobile money transfer service that enables instant fund transfers 24x7 throughout the year. Key Features include instant credit to the beneficiary, availability 24x7 including Sundays and bank holidays, fund transfers using just the account number and IFSC Code, interbank electronic instant transfer, accessibility through mobile phones, and immediate account crediting upon request. Required Information includes the beneficiary’s account number and IFSC Code. Benefits include real-time fund transfers, round-the-clock availability including holidays, instant access to your bank account, no waiting for banking hours, and suitability for urgent payments. Call to Action: Access IMPS through your PDCC Bank mobile banking app and experience instant money transfers anytime, anywhere.

answer: PDCC Bank offers Safe Deposit Locker facilities in multiple sizes at branches across both urban and rural areas to securely store your valuables, jewellery, and important documents. Key Features include wide availability of locker locations and sizes, multiple size options (Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large), discounts on locker rent for advance payments of 2 or 3 years, competitive rentals based on location and size, and nominee facility availability. Eligible customers include Individuals, Limited Companies, Associations, and Trusts. Locker Types and Rates: Locker A – Annual Rent ₹555.19 (₹750 for 1 year, ₹1,470 for 2 years, ₹2,190 for 3 years) with ₹9,000 deposit; Locker B – ₹884.95 (₹900/₹1,765/₹2,630) with ₹10,000 deposit; Locker C – ₹1,110.37 (₹1,200/₹2,350/₹3,505) with ₹14,000 deposit; Locker D – ₹1,378.12 (₹1,400/₹2,745/₹4,090) with ₹16,000 deposit; Locker E – ₹1,930.11 (₹2,000/₹3,920/₹5,845) with ₹23,000 deposit; Locker F – ₹2,220.75 (₹2,200/₹4,310/₹6,430) with ₹25,000 deposit; Locker G – ₹2,234.16 (₹2,300/₹4,510/₹6,720) with ₹26,000 deposit; Locker H – ₹2,930.81 (₹3,000/₹5,880/₹8,765) with ₹34,000 deposit; Locker I – ₹4,109.27 (₹4,000/₹7,840/₹11,685) with ₹45,000 deposit; Locker J – ₹6,489.65 (₹5,000/₹9,800/₹14,610) with ₹56,000 deposit. Note: Locker rent rates are revised from 15/07/2013. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch to rent a safe deposit locker and secure your valuables today.

Key Features include an electronic debit facility for electricity bills, free-of-cost service for customers, automatic payment processing, and no need to visit bill payment centers. question: What are the benefits of using a RuPay Debit Card?
How can I activate my debit card for the first time?
What should I do after receiving my debit card and PIN mailer?
How can I keep my ATM PIN secure?
Can I use my debit card for shopping and online payments?
What precautions should I take while using an ATM?
How can I withdraw cash using my debit card at an ATM?
What should I do if I forget my debit card PIN?
Is my debit card accepted at all merchant outlets?
How do I make a purchase using my RuPay Debit Card at a store?
Can I use my debit card for contactless 'Tap & Go' payments?
How do I use my RuPay Debit Card for online transactions?
What details are required for e-commerce transactions?
What is the use of the CVD2 number on the back of my card?
What should I do if my card gets damaged or bent?
Why should I sign on the back of my debit card?
How do I know if my RuPay Debit Card is valid for use?
Can I check my account balance or mini statement using my card?
How can I protect the magnetic stripe and chip on my card?
What happens if I lose my debit card or it gets stolen?
answer: The RuPay Debit Card from PDCC Bank offers 24x7 banking and shopping convenience with secure transactions. Key Features include 24x7 accessibility, association with NPCI, cash withdrawals at any ATM across India, balance enquiry and mini statements, contactless 'Tap & Go' payments, and secure online transactions with OTP verification. Card Components: Front side includes a 16-digit Card Number, Cardholder’s Name, Validity (month/year), RuPay Logo, DI Chip, and Wi-Fi Symbol for contactless payments. Back side includes a Magnetic Stripe, Signature Panel, and CVD2 for online transaction verification. Safety Tips: Read the User Guide and PIN Mailer carefully, sign the card immediately, memorize your PIN and destroy the mailer, never share or write your PIN, avoid help from strangers at ATMs, keep your PIN confidential, store your card safely, protect it from sunlight and electronic devices, and avoid scratching, bending, or placing two cards together. ATM Usage Steps: Insert card and remove it, select language, enter PIN, choose desired transaction (cash withdrawal, balance enquiry, mini statement), amount is debited instantly, then collect your card and cash. Merchant Usage: Accepted at all outlets displaying the RuPay logo — the merchant swipes the card, customer enters PIN, transaction is processed, and the customer should sign and retain their copy of the charge slip. Online Transactions: Use the card number, expiry date, and CVV for purchases; OTP is sent to the registered mobile number for confirmation. Call to Action: First use of the card at any ATM implies acceptance of the Terms & Conditions and User Guide.

question: What is a Fixed Deposit and how does it work?
How can I open a Fixed Deposit account?
What documents are required to open a Fixed Deposit?

What is the minimum age to open a Fixed Deposit account?
Are Fixed Deposit receipts kept safely by the bank?
Is there a difference in interest for short-term and long-term deposits?
Can I withdraw my Fixed Deposit before maturity?
How often is interest compounded or paid on Fixed Deposits?
Are Fixed Deposit interest rates fixed or do they change over time?
What is the extra benefit for senior citizens on Fixed Deposits?
What is the maximum deposit limit for resident Fixed Deposits?
Can non-resident Indians open a Fixed Deposit?
How do I calculate the maturity amount of a Fixed Deposit?
Can I split my Fixed Deposit into multiple tenures?
How can I ensure my Fixed Deposit is safe and secure?
answer: The PDCC Bank Fixed Deposit (FD) Scheme provides a secure way to earn higher interest on surplus funds with flexible tenure options. Key Features include secure investment with guaranteed returns, issuance of an FD receipt to be presented at maturity, renewal options for further periods, safe custody of FD receipts by the bank, loan facility on principal and accrued interest, and multiple interest payment options such as quarterly, monthly at discounted value, or compounded quarterly. Eligibility: Indian nationals aged 18 years or older. Required Documents: Application form, proof of identity, proof of address, recent photographs, and PAN/Form 60/61. Interest Rates: 7–14 days (₹15 Lakh and above) – 3.50%, 15–29 days – 4.00%, 30–45 days – 4.00%, 46–90 days – 5.00%, 91–180 days – 6.00%, 181 days to less than 1 year – 6.50%, 1 year to less than 2 years – 7.00%, and 2 years to less than 10 years – 6.75%. Senior citizens enjoy an additional 1% interest rate. Notes: Interest rates are subject to change, applicable to resident deposits below ₹1 crore, and offer both financial security and flexibility. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch to open a Fixed Deposit account and start earning attractive returns on your savings.

question: What is a Recurring Deposit and how does it work?

Can senior citizens get higher interest rates on Recurring Deposits?

Can I withdraw my Recurring Deposit before maturity?
Is the investment in Recurring Deposits safe?
Can I increase my monthly installment during the tenure of the Recurring Deposit?
How do I calculate the maturity amount of my Recurring Deposit?
Are there any penalties for late deposit in a Recurring Deposit?
Can Recurring Deposits be linked to my savings account for auto-debit?
What are the tax benefits, if any, of investing in a Recurring Deposit?
answer: The PDCC Bank Recurring Deposit (RD) Scheme helps you build savings systematically through monthly contributions while earning attractive interest rates. Key Features include small monthly investments starting from ₹1,000 (in multiples of ₹100), a maximum limit of ₹14,99,900 per month, TDS exemption on interest earned as per current income tax rules, availability of loan against deposit, high interest rates equivalent to Fixed Deposit rates, nomination facility, and interest rates aligned with PDCC Bank’s TDR/STDR for the chosen period. Required Documents include a completed application form (available on the website), valid proof of identity (PAN Card, Voter ID, Passport, or Driving License), proof of address (recent Telephone or Electricity Bill), three recent color photographs, and PAN or Form 60/61 if applicable. Important Notes: Penalty charges apply for missed monthly installments, and any applicable government charges or taxes will be debited from the customer’s account. Call to Action: Download the application form and visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch to start your Recurring Deposit account today.

question: What are the current term deposit interest rates?

answer: PDCC Bank offers attractive Term Deposit Interest Rates to help you grow your savings securely. The Savings Account rate is 3.00%. Term Deposit Rates include: 3.50% for 7–14 days (for deposits ≥ ₹15 Lakh), 4.00% for 15–29 days and 30–45 days, 5.00% for 46–90 days, 6.00% for 91–180 days, 6.50% for 181 days to less than 1 year, 7.00% for 1 year to less than 2 years, and 6.75% for 2 years to less than 10 years. Senior citizens enjoy an additional 1% interest on all deposits. Key Points: Interest rates vary by tenure, longer durations offer higher returns, special rates are available for high-value deposits (≥ ₹15 Lakh), and all rates are periodically revised. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch to learn more and open a Term Deposit account today.

answer: PDCC Bank offers convenient Personal Loans with simple procedures, minimal documentation, and fast approval for a variety of personal needs. Key Features include: easy application process, quick approval, eligibility for salaried individuals, self-employed professionals, and businessmen, EMI facility for both new and existing customers, and the flexibility to make additional repayments without extra charges. The loan can be used for purposes such as house repairs, renovation, furniture purchase, and consumer durables. Eligibility requires a minimum of 2 years of continuous employment and two guarantors. Required Documents: Account statement or passbook, three photographs of borrower and guarantors, Aadhaar and Ration cards, electricity bill, quotations of proposed expenses, and any other documents as required by the bank. Disclaimer: The information provided is for awareness and general guidance about PDCC Bank’s services. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch for detailed information and to apply for a personal loan.

Two guarantors are mandatory. Disclaimer: Information is for awareness and indicative of PDCC’s services. Call to Action: Visit the nearest PDCC branch for detailed information.

Are all banking transactions chargeable at normal published rates?
answer: PDCC Bank offers Home Loans with no hidden charges, quick processing, and flexible repayment options for purchasing or constructing your dream home. Key features include EMI facility for new and existing customers, daily reducing balance method, and the option to make additional repayments without extra charges. Required Documents: account statement/passbook, three photographs of borrower and guarantors, Aadhaar and ration cards, electricity bill, and other documents as required by the bank. Security: The loan is secured by the financed property and/or other collateral as required by PDCC. Important Notes: All transactions are subject to standard bank charges, and information provided is indicative. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch for more details.

question: What is the interest rate for a home loan top-up?
How is the interest calculated on a top-up loan?
What is the maximum amount I can borrow under a top-up loan?
Can I avail a top-up loan up to ₹10 Lakh?
What is the maximum tenure for a home loan top-up?
Can the top-up loan be taken for a period less than 10 years?
Can I use the top-up loan for home renovation?
Is vehicle purchase allowed under the top-up loan?
Can I use the top-up loan for education expenses?
Can medical expenses be financed using a top-up loan?
Is it possible to use the loan for my child's marriage function?
Can overdue credit card payments be cleared using this loan?
Are business loans included in the purposes for top-up loans?
Can other approved purposes be considered for the top-up loan?
How is eligibility for a top-up loan determined?
Does the bank consider current property valuation for top-up loan eligibility?
Is my current income evaluated for top-up loan approval?
How is repayment capacity assessed by the bank?
What other expenses should I expect when taking a top-up loan?
Who bears the processing fee, search fee, and assessment fee?
Is insurance premium included in the borrower's responsibility?
Are stamp duty and registration charges paid by the applicant?
Do I need to pay 20% of the original loan before availing a top-up?
Is it mandatory to insure the property financed by the top-up loan?
Can the insurance policy be in the borrower's name only?
Is joint insurance with the bank required?
Do I have to continuously renew and submit the insurance policy to the bank?
What is the purpose of providing a guarantee letter to the bank?
answer: PDCC Bank offers Top-Up Home Loans on existing home loans for purposes such as renovation, education, medical expenses, marriage, business needs, and more. Interest Rate: Current home loan rate + 1%. Maximum Loan Amount: ₹10 Lakh. Maximum Tenure: 10 years. Eligibility depends on property valuation, borrower's income, and repayment capacity, with at least 20% of the original loan repaid. Expected Expenses include processing, search, assessment, insurance, stamp duty, and registration fees, all borne by the applicant. The property must be insured against fire and other risks, with the policy assigned or jointly held with the bank and renewed regularly. Borrowers must also provide a guarantee letter. Call to Action: Visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch for details on top-up home loan eligibility and application.

answer: PDCC Bank offers Short-Term Agriculture Loans for landholders with simplified documentation, quick processing, and no hidden charges. The loan provides instant approvals and competitive interest rates. Required Documents include Aadhaar Card and any other documents requested by the bank. Interest Rates vary: for big and small landholder members – up to ₹3 lakh: Bank Level 4.00%, Society Level 8.00%; above ₹3 lakh: Bank Level 4.00%, Society Level 6.00%; other cases: Bank Level 6.00%, Society Level 11.00%. Overdue interest applies as 8% + 1% penalty at bank level and 11% + 1% penalty at society level. Terms and conditions are subject to revision. Call to Action: Contact the nearest PDCC Bank branch for detailed information.

answer: PDCC Bank offers Medium-Term Agriculture Loans to help farmers expand and establish agricultural and allied sector projects. These loans finance activities like replanting orchards, setting up dairy or poultry infrastructure, and purchasing machinery such as tractors, harvesters, or pumps. The scheme features simplified documentation, easy processing, and quick approvals, with no upper loan limit for established farmers. Required Documents include land extracts, Aadhaar card, business plans, budgets, and any other documents requested by the bank. Interest Rates: Bank Level – 10.00%, Society Level – 12.00%. There are 52 types of eligible loans, including tractor purchase, irrigation systems, rural godam, poultry, fisheries, solar pumps, and more. Terms and conditions are subject to revision. Call to Action: Contact the nearest PDCC Bank branch for detailed information.

What is the interest rate for Anjeer Plantation loans?
answer: PDCC Bank offers Long-Term Agriculture Loans to encourage investment credit, capital formation, and technological advancement for farmers and entrepreneurs. These loans help create income-generating assets in agriculture and allied sectors, including small-scale industries, handicrafts, handlooms, and micro enterprises. The scheme features simplified documentation, quick processing, and easy access to funds. Financing is available for both capital outlay and initial production costs, with no upper loan limit for established farmers or those with strong financial records. Required Documents: Land extracts, Aadhaar card, business plans, budgets, cash flow forecasts, and other documents requested by the bank. Interest Rate: 10.00%. Eligible loan types include Upsa Jalchinan, Poultry, Sheep Rearing, Buffalo Rearing, Grape Farm, Rose (Composite Farm), Fruit Farm, and Anjeer Plantation. Terms and conditions are subject to revision. For more details, contact the nearest PDCC Bank branch.

answer: PDCC Bank offers competitive interest rates for a wide range of non-agriculture loan products catering to individuals, businesses, co-operative societies, and organizations. The available loan types and their respective interest rates are as follows: Individual Salary Earner Cash Credit – 10.50%, Hire Purchase – 10.50%, Educational Loan / Flat Purchase / House Construction – 10.50%, Gold Loan – 9.50%, Non-Farm Sector – 10.50%, Industrial Term Loan – 10.50%, Industrial Cash Credit – 10.50%, Agro Clinic – 10.25%, Hypothecation Non-Agri Loan – 10.50%, Mortgage – 12.50%, Pledge Non-Agri Loan – 11.50%, Term Loan / Hundi – 12.00%, M.T / L.T Loan (Sugar Factory) – 10.50%, Hypothecation Sugar Factory – 12.00%, Pledge Sugar Factory – 10.50%, Sugar Preshipment up to 180 days – 10.50%, Sugar Preshipment from 181 to 270 days – 10.50%, Set Aside / Irregular Pledge Loan / Inadequate Loan / WCTL – 12.50%, Clean (Sugar Factory) – 12.50%, All Types of Temporary Loans – 12.00%, All Types of Middle Term Loan – 10.00%, Salary Earners Society Term Loan & Cash Credit – 10.50%, Urban Co-operative Societies Term Loan – 12.00%, Co-operative Bank Term Loan / Cash Credit – 11.00%, Rural Artisan Scheme (Short Term / Medium Term) – 10.00%, Transport Societies Loan – 11.00%, Sell Purchase Sangh Term Loan – 11.00%, Traders Cash Credit – 10.50%, Employee Cash Credit – 10.25%, S.G.S.Y. – 7.00%, Self Help Group – 8.50%, Self Help Group Cash Credit – 8.00%, Commercial / Private Vehicle (3 / 4 Tyre) – 10.50%, Medium Term Vehicle Loan – 10.50%, Employee Computer Loan – 10.25%, Loan Against N.S.C. Certificate – 10.25%, Loan Against FD (Individual / Society) – FD Loan + 2%, Long Term Office Rent – 11.00%, and Loan Term Agri Income Bazar Simiti – 11.00%. These interest rates are subject to revision based on bank policies. For detailed information and the latest updates on loan terms and applicable rates, visit your nearest PDCC Bank branch.
